page.title: 19Traffic in Lyndhurst
page.content: The current concern amongst the residents living south of Lyndhurst, is the problem caused by traffic. There are two busy roads leading southwards out of Lyndhurst towards the New Forest. These pass through an attractive residential area. The majority of people living there are of an older generation and appreciate the peaceful atmosphere. Therefore, in summer when Lyndhurst becomes a tourist attraction the traffic disturbs their peace. Lyndhurst's narrow roads are not designed for heavy traffic which tourists cause. The residents have been awaiting plans for a proposed by-pass, to control this increasing problem. However, opposing this suggested solution is the argument of the Forestry Commission, saying that to implement these plans would ruin the landscape.
